args:
Ryszarda and Raphael reveal Grams' intentions
to Tobias, including the fact that Nino contains
the ＂key to perdition＂ within her. Meanwhile,
Nino is abducted by perditionist killers.
Tobias races to her aid before it is too late...
What's the Northern Church's real aim in\nsheltering Nino?
I'm sorry, but I'm not at liberty to discuss\nthe content of our orders.
And I can't allow her to go with you when I\ndon't know your intentions.
She will be safe in The Curia.\nI swear it on the Goddess.
The oath of one who conspires behind\nclosed doors has little value, I'm afraid.
Then will you stand against us?\nPlease don't force our hand here, Tobias.
I, too, hoped it would not come to this.
Are you mad, woman?!\nDon't just leap between us!
I'm sorry, but our mission is to bring\nNino to the Curia, not to pick a fight!
And if we're made to choose between that\nmission and staying our hands? This fight\nis his choice, not mine.
A choice he's only making because we\nwon't tell him the truth.
If we're just honest with him, he might\nactually HELP us do our jobs and this\nwhole thing will go a lot smoother.
Ugh... I hate it when you're the voice of\nreason.
Tobias, can I ask you to reserve judgment\nuntil after you've heard us out?
Of course. And I apologize for being hasty.
Please explain. Why does the Northern\nChurch want Nino so badly?
Because she holds the ＂key to perdition.＂
I know you're with the perditionists, but\njust how much do you know of the Scrolls?
I know it's an ancient text claiming the\nOther was the Goddess's child. That it was\nfound in the Southern Curia's libraries.
So none of the juicy bits, it sounds like.
The text setting the South ablaze now was\nconfiscated from Dyrenell by the Church\nafter the Second War of Binding.
The Empire's founder was a pious believer.\nAllegedly, he discovered the Scrolls in\nClave Loy'elune.
He underwent training to foster a\nspecial form of mana within him, then\nused that to open an otherworld gate.
I'd never heard such a tale of the Scrolls'\nprovenance...
That brings us to the heart of the matter.\nThe text Dyrenell's founder acquired is but\none fragment of a whole.
The Scrolls of Perdition were divided into\nseveral parts, and each was sealed away\nin the otherworld.
Opening the gate to reach them requires a\nkey formed of that unique mana.

Which brings us to the aforementioned
＂key to perdition.＂ A handful of families
are said to have inherited the mana
required to create that key.
One is the bloodline of the first Dyrenell\nemperor. And the scion of the other family\nthe Northern Church is tracking...
When I shared my dreams of the outside world,\nSonniere told me this—
The noble blood courses within you, and\nwith it, the key to a millennium-old truth,\nleft to us by the great one.
If those birthrights come to light, the\nChurch will stop at nothing to find you.
I fear this hidden village is the only place\nyou will find peace in this world.
As long as I was the Goddess's descendant,\nI would never fly free. But as I stewed in my\nmisery, a voice called out to me.
Your feelings will take form and become\nyour strength, just as it did for the one who\nsought a happier future for her world.
As long as you do not abandon hope, the\nwing that sleeps within you will surely—
Was it a hallucination?\nA product of my desperate longing?\nOr...
Ngh... Where...? I can't move! Ropes?!
Finally awake, dear?\nYou're just outside Peng Lai.
I asked her to bring you here to me.
The priest who attacked us in Purgatorum!\n...So you're a perditionist, too?
I'm a free agent, dear. A killer for a price\nwho happened to sign a contract. Same as\nthe others around you.
They're skilled hunters, so don't get any\nsilly ideas about running. I'd hate for you\nto be hurt before the ritual.
Ritual? So you mean to use\nme to create the key to perdition.
The Lineage Council people spoke of it.\nThey said a few perditionists were after\nthe key to get at the rest of the Scrolls.
And that they intended to make a sacrifice\nof someone with that special mana—to\nharvest their soul for its core component.
You must know we take no pleasure in\nending a life. But all our research has\nconcluded that this is the only way.

The family lines that bear special mana
are sacrificial lambs. Through the rite,
their souls are to be remade into the key
to revelation.
You will gift unto humanity the truth left to\nus by the Goddess Herself a millennium\nago.
Your death will pave the path to true\npeace, in accordance with the Goddess's\nwill. I am but her faithful executor!
You actually believe that murdering me\nwill get you what you want?
It's been passed down that our mana is\nrequired to get at the Scrolls. And that it\nwas our ancestors who authored them.
But somehow you've deluded yourselves \ninto thinking you need to kill someone to\nrealize your aspirations.
You would imply that our intelligence is\nflawed? Then how do you propose we\nacquire the Scrolls?
I don't know any better than you. The way\nto retrieve them has been lost to time.
Seeing as my ancestors passed down a\ncharm to keep their children safe, though,\nI can tell you this much:
They weren't the sorts of people to place a\ncurse of human sacrifice upon their own\nbloodline.
Is the Goddess you worship the sort of\nbloodthirsty lunatic who preaches mercy\nwhile demanding slaughter?
No. She isn't. I thought you were troubled\nby the rot within the Church like Tobias is.\nWell, this smells awfully rotten to me.
...I am not wrong. I am not, I am not, I am\nnot, I am not, I am not, I AM NOT WRONG!\nI cannot be!
Passing judgment upon the heretics who\ndeny the Scrolls' truth, sending assassins\nto claim the chime... All of it was just!
The Goddess has revealed to us that\ntruth cannot be found without sacrifice!\nI am enacting her divine will!
To claim the... Then it was you who killed\nSonniere?!
My heart will not be led astray, temptress.\nWe will know the truth of the ritual once it\nis complete!
Now, let us begin! The key to perdition\nwill be ours, here and now!
You won't lay a finger on her.
